basics.name: Omkar Patil
basics.label: CS PhD @ ASU
basics.summary: My aim is to add value to society by doing impactful research and innovation. I have a strong background in Machine Learning and Robotics from my Master’s degree at IIT Madras. After graduation, I gained valuable work experience in NLP research at Wells Fargo. Currently, I have joined the PhD program at ASU and will be working in Dr. Nakul Gopalan's lab at ASU on robot learning.

publications.name: Compositional Few-shot Learning of Motions
publications.publisher: Compositional Learning Workshop @ NeurIPS 2024 | Omkar Patil, Nakul Gopalan
publications.summary: A novel compositional approach called DSE- Diffusion Score Equilibrium that enables few-shot learning for novel skills by utilizing a combination of base policy priors is presented.

publications.name: Hardware-Software Co-Design for Path Planning by Drones
publications.publisher: IROS 2024 | Ayushi Dube, Omkar Patil, Gian Singh, Nakul Gopalan, and Sarma Vrudhula
publications.summary: This work consists of designing a hardware-software co-design, MT+, for adapting the Mikami-Tabuchi (MT) algorithm for on-board path planning by drones in a 3D environment.

publications.name: Learning Temporally Composable Task Segmentations with Language
publications.publisher: IROS 2024 | Divyanshu Raj, Omkar Patil, Weiwei Gu, Chitta Baral and Nakul Gopalan
publications.summary: We present an approach to identify sub-tasks within a demonstrated robot trajectory with the supervision provided by language instructions.

publications.name: Understanding metrics for paraphrasing
publications.publisher: Arxiv | Omkar Patil, Rahul Singh, Tarun Joshi
publications.summary: We propose a novel metric ROUGE-P to measure the quality of paraphrases along the dimensions of adequacy, novelty and fluency.

publications.name: Document automation architectures and technologies: A survey
publications.publisher: Arxiv | Mohammad Ahmadi Achachlouei, Omkar Patil, Tarun Joshi, Vijayan N Nair
publications.summary: This paper surveys the current state of the art in document automation in light of recent advances in artificial intelligence and deep neural networks.

work.name: Arizona State University
work.summary: Research assistant in Dr. Nakul Gopalan's lab at Arizona State University.

work.name: Wells Fargo
work.summary: Member of the Artificial Intelligence and Automation team within Corporate Model Risk.
highlights: Researched and implemented prompt-tuning on language models for generating different kinds of paraphrases for downstream applications such as robustness testing.
Collaborated with other researchers within the team to develop methodologies for evaluating model weaknesses with a special focus on text classification models.

work.name: Wells Fargo
work.summary: Member of the Artificial Intelligence and Automation team within Corporate Model Risk.
highlights: Explored text generation for the task of paraphrasing and developed a new metric to evaluate the quality of paraphrases.
Surveyed various document automation frameworks present in literature.
Contributed significantly to the internal code library and made several presentations on research projects, across the group

work.name: Eaton
work.summary: Survey research on amorphous metals in the Additive Manufacturing team.
highlights: Performed extensive literature review to put forward Eaton products that could benefit from amorphous metals.
Enhanced cold spray simulation capability by creating a Python script for the fluid dynamics part of the simulation

work.name: Institute WebOps and MobOps
work.summary: Lead of the official mobile development team of IIT Madras.
highlights: Led a team of 9 students for the development of the ‘Students App’, managing a budget of ~INR 3L.
Increased the number of active users by ~160%, to 6500+ students, with 12000+ downloads in total.
Developed a sophisticated Java front-end and PHP back-end to build a secure and useful application on Android.
Introduced innovative features such as a complaints portal, institute-attuned timetable, and calendar

volunteer.summary: Non-governmental organization for the welfare of underprivileged children.
highlights: Quickly ramped up with the current operations of reselling scrap newspaper and facilitating education for the needy with the obtained proceeds
Streamlined the scrap collection under the ‘Pasti Ki Pathshala' project by creating a database of participants willing to donate scrap newspaper
Organized a collection drive at a local school for 800+ students to promote the idea of social welfare
